definition: a speech addressed to a public assembly
examples: listening to his capacious harangue and its immaculate delivery
the long, tiresome harangue so characteristic of … books on the subject
gave me a harangue on the subject of my poor grades

definition: to make a harangue (see harangue entry 1) : declaim
examples: poets … and philosophers recited their works, and harangued for diversion
haranguing me … on the folly of my ways
